senses.de: The regular doing of something to improve skill
senses.ex: Without practice, you cannot perform well.

Tips.title: Frequency Matters
Tips.description: The more frequently you practice, the quicker you'll improve.
Tips.example: Her daily practice improved her skills rapidly.

Tips.title: Consistent Effort
Tips.description: Practicing consistently, even in short sessions, is more effective than occasional long sessions.
Tips.example: He spent 30 minutes practicing every day.

senses.de: The work or profession of a doctor, dentist, or lawyer
senses.ex: He just started his medical practice.

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: When linked with professions, 'practice' implies an establishment or ongoing business.
Tips.example: She opened her own legal practice.

Tips.title: Skill Application
Tips.description: In professional domains, 'practice' highlights applying skills rather than acquiring them.
Tips.example: The doctors at this practice are very experienced.

senses.ex: It has been a long-standing practice to give presents at Christmas.

Tips.title: Cultural Norms
Tips.description: The word can reference widely accepted societal habits or norms.
Tips.example: In our culture, it's common practice to remove shoes indoors.

Tips.title: Practical Application
Tips.description: 'Practice' often refers to the actual application of ideas, differing from theory.
Tips.example: In practice, the new protocols are not effective.

senses.de: Perform an activity repeatedly to improve
senses.ex: She is practicing the piano for the concert.

Tips.title: Skill Precision
Tips.description: Verb use emphasizes precision and refinement through repetition.
Tips.example: She practiced her speech multiple times.

Tips.title: Repetitive Action
Tips.description: Using 'practice' as a verb conveys action, focus, and repetitiveness.
Tips.example: Musicians must practice daily to excel.

senses.de: Do what one professes or preaches
senses.ex: The priest always practices what he preaches.

Tips.title: Moral Congruency
Tips.description: It implies consistency between what one advises others to do and what one does.
Tips.example: She practices the eco-friendly methods she promotes.

Tips.title: Authenticity
Tips.description: Using the verb form denotes sincerity and authenticity in actions.
Tips.example: A good leader practices transparency with their team.

Custom.wordDefinition:
Custom refers to a tradition or way of doing things that has been established over time within a particular group or society.

It can be an individual or collective effort, and is often informed by established customs or traditions.

Both words are applicable in different contexts, but custom is more closely associated with cultural or societal traditions, while practice is more closely associated with personal or professional habits and routines.

For example, it is a custom in many societies to celebrate birthdays with cake and gifts, while it is a common practice for athletes to train daily to improve their performance.

Drill.wordDefinition:
Drill refers to repetitive exercises that are meant to help with skill development or muscle memory.

It is often used in the context of military or sports training. For example, soldiers may drill in marching or weapon handling, while athletes might drill in passing or shooting.

Drill is focused on developing specific skills or physical abilities, while practice is focused on improving overall performance through repetition and refinement.

Exercise.wordDefinition:
Exercise refers to physical activity done specifically to improve one's health, fitness, or strength.

It is usually planned, structured and repetitive, such as jogging or lifting weights. Exercise is applicable to maintaining a healthy body and preventing diseases.

Exercise is something you do to stay healthy, while practice is something you do to get better at something.

Habit.wordDefinition:
Habit describes a behavior that we do automatically without much thought or effort because we have done it many times before.

For example, brushing teeth before bed is a habit. We don't really think about it, we just do it because we have done it so many times before. Habits are formed over time.

To summarize, a habit is a behavior that we do without thinking about it, while practicing is intentionally repeating a task in order to improve.

Habits are usually daily routines, whereas practicing happens on a scheduled and focused time.

Rehearsal.wordDefinition:
Rehearsal refers to the act of practicing a specific performance or event, typically in preparation for a public performance.

Practice is more general and involves repeating an activity to improve skills, while rehearsal is more specific and involves practicing a specific performance or event.

Routine.wordDefinition:
Routine refers to a sequence of actions that are regularly followed, often on a daily basis, regardless of whether there is a specific goal involved.

For example, a morning routine may involve getting dressed, brushing teeth, and having breakfast.

Practice is applicable when someone wants to improve or develop a particular skill, while routine is applicable when someone wants to establish a regular habit or pattern of behavior.

Train.wordDefinition:
Train refers to the process of teaching or preparing someone to perform a specific task or job. This can involve instruction, guidance, and practice sessions to develop the necessary skills.

Practice is more focused on individual skill development, while train is geared towards preparing someone for a particular job or task.

Workout.wordDefinition:
Workout generally refers to physical exercise aimed at building strength, endurance, or overall fitness.

Both terms can describe intentional and focused efforts to improve oneself, but practice usually implies a more skill-based approach, while workout emphasizes physical fitness.

quotes.Text: Don't only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets; art deserves that, for it and knowledge can raise man to the Divine.
quotes.Title: German Composer
quotes.Name: Ludwig van Beethoven

quotes.Text: I think of the important things: how to prepare, how to practice, how to prepare to practice.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jimmy Garoppolo

quotes.Text: The head learns new things, but the heart forever practices old experiences.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.Text: When you practice gratefulness, there is a sense of respect toward others.
quotes.Title: Tibetan Leader
quotes.Name: Dalai Lama

quotes.Text: I think deep down I'm spiritual, but there's nothing I practice.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: Stella McCartney

quotes.Text: Life has a practice of living you, if you don't live it.
quotes.Title: English Poet
quotes.Name: Philip Larkin

quotes.Text: I was deep in the zone of practicing almost constantly.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Pat Metheny

quotes.Text: Life doesn't give you all the practice races you need.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jesse Owens

quotes.Text: I said in sharp language that that practice was wrong.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Ken Starr

quotes.Text: I try to practice with my life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Herbie Hancock
